terms.definition: Help content in software applications that is tailored to the user's specific location, task, or current situation within the app, rather than providing generic documentation.
Interactive assistance and tutorials provided directly within a software application to help users complete tasks and learn features without leaving the interface.
Small pop-up text boxes that appear when hovering over or clicking on UI elements to provide contextual information or explanations.
The amount of mental effort and working memory required for a user to process information and complete tasks in an interface.
The process of introducing new users to a software application through guided experiences that help them understand key features and workflows.
Visual overlays with spotlight effects that highlight specific UI elements while dimming the rest of the interface to focus user attention.
Short, contextual text snippets used in user interfaces, such as button labels, error messages, and input field placeholders, to guide user actions.
Sequential guided tutorials that break down complex processes into individual steps, often using overlays or highlights to direct user attention.
User Interface - the visual elements and interactive components through which users interact with software applications.
Automated conversational interfaces that use AI to provide real-time assistance and answer user questions within applications.
A usability metric that measures the percentage of users who successfully complete a specific task or workflow within an application.
The rate at which users stop using or abandon a software application over a specific time period.
The ability for users to find answers and resolve issues independently without contacting customer support.
Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality - immersive technologies that overlay digital information on the real world or create entirely virtual environments.
Recordings of user interactions within an application that allow developers and UX teams to analyze user behavior and identify usability issues.
